title: [BUG] `ForecastingGridSearchCV` with `NaiveForecaster` produces inconsistent column names  :  userwarning
body:
### Discussed in https://github.com/sktime/sktime/discussions/3498
Originally posted by **Ajay-user** September 28, 2022 Hi , I'm new to sktime I'm getting this user waring when using forecastingGridSearchCV **UserWarning**: y_pred and y_true do not have the same column index. This may indicate incorrect objects passed to the metric. Indices of y_true will be used for y_pred. Is there any work-around ? or is it normal? [sktime documentation link](https://www.sktime.org/en/stable/api_reference/auto_generated/sktime.forecasting.model_selection.ForecastingGridSearchCV.html ) ```python from sktime.datasets import load_shampoo_sales from sktime.forecasting.naive import NaiveForecaster from sktime.forecasting.model_selection import ForecastingGridSearchCV, ExpandingWindowSplitter y = load_shampoo_sales() fh = [1,2,3] cv = ExpandingWindowSplitter( start_with_window=True, fh=fh) forecaster = NaiveForecaster() param_grid = {"strategy" : ["last", "mean", "drift"]} gscv = ForecastingGridSearchCV( forecaster=forecaster, param_grid=param_grid, cv=cv) gscv.fit(y) ``` _UserWarning_: _y_pred and y_true do not have the same column index. This may indicate incorrect objects passed to the metric. Indices of y_true will be used for y_pred._
